website_summaries.verdict: This powerful WiFi extender is ideal for large homes, while providing internet speeds up to 1900 Mbps.
pros: Sleek design that fits easily on a desktop
Produces a strong, reliable signal that covers a large area
cons: Some users find the included setup instructions to be a little confusing

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT update to the latest firmware 1.0.1.78
customer_reviews.text: *** UPDATE December 18, 2019 *** Updating the firmware from v.1.0.0.66 to v.1.0.1.84_1.0.148 was successful. *** Original Post *** DO NOT update to the latest firmware 1.0.1.78; it disables the extender! I was able to replicate this problem with multiple units. I have brought this up with Netgear Support. Unfortunately, Netgear is keeping this firmware up on their website, and encouraging users to update to this version.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Worked for ONE year TO THE DAY!
customer_reviews.text: Failed exactly one year after purchase! Is this one of those products with a self-destruct chip that knows when its out of warranty! ;-) I'm pretty bummed out because most reviews point to one or another Netgear extenders as the best type to buy, currently. I don't typically return with loyal patronage to a mfr who's product lasts ONE year...I might as well have rented one for $10/mo! It doesn't work on 5G channel at all anymore and drops 2.4G every few minutes even after firmware update and completely new set up. Have everything that can reach it running straight off my TP-Link router, now
customer_reviews.author: Discriminating Buyer

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF TIME & MONEY!!
customer_reviews.text: Only one star because you can't have NEGATIVE a million stars! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!! I've been troubleshooting this garbage for almost two months hoping it would hold an internet connection and of course now I'm beyond the return window. My modem/router is netgear also so I ASSuME it would connect reliably - WRONG! Constantly drops internet connection, does NOT transition device from router to extender smoothly - completely restarts connecting to wifi. I've tried restarting extender, router, resetting extender, static IP, dynamic IP, same SSID, different SSID, connecting via ethernet - all FAIL with this POS. REPEAT - AVOID!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: good range. strong connection
customer_reviews.text: i upgraded from the itty bitty wifi extender that plugged directly into the wall with the 2 little antennas. This wifi extender is a beast. Looks like a ps2 slim. 3 sturdy lookin antennae. pretty straightforward to setup. got pretty much 80% wifi strength throughout the house. 95% in the adjacent rooms. one of the adjacent rooms used to fluctuate from 12%-70%. now we got a strong wifi connection in there. i like how the power cable is pretty long, so you have some options to where you want to place it, as opposed to having it fixed to an outlet low on the ground.... yeah, awesome wifi extender
customer_reviews.author: harlow

customer_reviews.title: daily reboot
customer_reviews.text: works great for a few months then requires a daily reboot. I have 1Gbps internet connection. The wired connection runs awesome at first i've clocked 980mbps regularly however every day i check it and i only get 100mbs i then reboot back up to +900mbps. It's frustration rebooting the router every day. no information on the internet on how to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complete home wifi mesh network? ...Done!
customer_reviews.text: Wireless networking stinks; it's tedious, fault-prone, and a bear to troubleshoot. However, it's a convenience 99.9% of us, 99.9% of the time can't live without. The ex7000, for about $100, pairs with your access point/router, and any number (?) of additional ex7000s to seamlessly cover your domain. Totally works. Our access point doesn't hit downstairs, and doesn't cover the back yard. Two ex7000s, properly configured, cover the entire place with a single SSID. Config. wasn't too bad; be thoughtful and patient. There are plenty of more expensive ways to create a large mesh network. However, I don't think there are cheaper/more modular ways that work as well (e.g. offer as much control without stealth spying features).
customer_reviews.author: A. Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Amazon warehouse junk
customer_reviews.text: 30 years in IT/IS couldn’t help the fact that the amazon warehouse is selling extremely old and outdated versions of this product. What got delivered today was dated 2016 It does not mesh. It does not share SSID with existing Nighthawk router. It is not manageable by Nighthawk app as advertised. And beyond all those limitations. When I set it up like an oldschool netgear extender, it never connects to the internet so never finishes install process. If you’re wanting the mesh extender and app support. Only buy new. Not amazon warehouse.
customer_reviews.author: Taggert

customer_reviews.title: This is not Mesh
customer_reviews.text: I thought this a good value so I ordered it. Mesh is important to me as I want the single SSID (no switching between networks when walking around my home). Product arrived and, despite having the correct model information, the box made no mention of it being Mesh. I thought that odd, so went back to the website to confirm what I read was correct. Sure enough, upon reading the instructions, I see that after set-up, this unit creates separate SSIDs with the _EXT nomenclature. Supposedly you can change the SSID, but that still does not mean this is a Mesh system as described. Probably why it was cheaper than the real Mesh extenders.
customer_reviews.author: HGTV Kings

customer_reviews.title: Device Defective
customer_reviews.text: Setup was difficult and the device frequently lost contact with the router despite being in close proximity. Once I got it working, any external devices that were connected by Ethernet functioned normally. But, devices connected via the WiFi channels (the primary purpose of the unit) could not see the Internet. After two hours of dialog and testing with Netgear Tech Support, they concluded the unit was probably defective. Back it goes to Amazon. I've already replaced it with a less expensive Linksys unit that after 24 hours of testing appears to be working as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Extends my range into a former dead zone, where my office (and source of much connectivity frustration) is. - Reliable. I’ve only lost connectivity to it once. Cons - The WPS setup did not work at all. I had to connect a CAT-5 cable to a laptop to configure it to our WiFi. - I’m within line-of-site range of the antennae, at about 25 feet, yet the signal isn’t pegged. Not huge, but interesting. - I get about 190Mbps out of my 400Mbps service. 50% loss is a little much, but it’s more than adequate. Not sure how that’ll hold up with visitors streaming TV, playing games, etc. But...again...for two of us, it’s more than adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos J

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: We could not get it to work. 2 hours on the phone w tech support by staff. Final conclusion by tech support: "It is defective. Send it back to Amazon." Running Network Preferences in Mojave after our network was disconnected on the attempted install, the system report stated that the NETGEAR WiFi Mesh Range Extender EX700, had the wrong country code. That it was for Malaysia. I am sure there is a way to program it. Not worth the additional time and expense. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: David Puu

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable thus far
customer_reviews.text: A user of many Netgear products, this had been one of the better performers. It is being used as an extender to an EX6200 in AP mode. Considering it a remote end to a daisy-chain of devices, it has been in service since November 2017 without any issues at all. While I do wish it had more features and better functionality with "access control" on the main servicing router, in the end it being reliable is to me the most important factor. I do not like using an email address to log into a router as others have commented, but I have not experienced any evidence of misuse, and don't use a primary email for these sort of things anyhow.
customer_reviews.author: dirocco

customer_reviews.title: Beware buying a "used" item, beware if you are trying to use both bands
customer_reviews.text: Initially tried to set up the extender, but eventually discovered that it can either be connected by wired Ethernet to the primary router, or to other wired Ethernet devices, but not both at the same time. Also, discovered that it would not maintain both a 2.4 GHz and a 5 GHz connection consistently. If I set its 2.4GHz IP address, then it would not maintain 5GHz connectivity, or vice versa. This is after doing the recommended firmware upgrade to the latest version. Also discovered that you cannot register a "Used" item with the manufacturer, so you can't get free support or warranty coverage. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: RJG Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Fails to deliver on promise
customer_reviews.text: The introduction of this device completely ruined the performance of wifi in my house. Even at short range where other devices are still capturing near-full bandwidth (200+ mbps) from my base station router (also a Netgear Nighthawk product), this mesh extender would often put through as little as 5-10 mbps. When I power cycle the device the performance improves, but usually degrades and needs to be rebooted within 48 hours. The introduction of the device onto my wifi network has also caused the base station to crash repeatedly--something that never happened before I installed it. If this is how it performs with other Netgear products, I can't imagine using it with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tom G.

customer_reviews.title: Clunky and under-powered.
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am not liking it. The software is clunky; it just hangs very often during set up, and you are forced to re-initiate it. The extender function also feels sub-optimal; my devices also hang or re-buffer very often. And since is has this mesh technology, you can't be selective in terms of choosing between the original router signal or the extended one. What is supposed to be a convenient feature turns out to actually erode the experience. So, devices that worked fine with the original signal now stutter and buffer frequently. I will pay attention for a few more days, but I may end up returning this -so far- lemon. I will update the review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: The new (late 2018) firmware will brick the Extender
customer_reviews.text: It was working just fine. Did a good job. I needed to move it to a different part of the house and in doing so, saw the updated firmware. Like many others I did the update and it bricked the extender. Now it will set up but it won't provide any internet on either extended band. Please pass the word. Do not update the firmware to the latest version. It has been designed by Netgear to brick the old systems necessitating a new purchase.
customer_reviews.author: W. K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice to get WiFi in areas I couldn't
customer_reviews.text: This was super nice to get WiFi setup in different areas of my house that had a weak signal. I was even able to get WiFi out 75 feet from my house which was really nice! I never had any signal in my garage before and now I can surf the net on my internet. Really nice! It was a little tricky to setup but nothing to tough considering I've dealt with this kind of stuff in the past. It would be nice if you could customize the settings a bit more but over all its not bad the way it's setup.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Poor to nonexistent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Unit only lasted 14 months and died slowly causing me to check everything around it. I would send it back for repair but there is absolutely NO customer service from Netgear. It's amazing how this company can sell a product and then rely on their "forums" for service. I would never own another piece of Netgear again and it's so sad as it worked good at first but slowly died.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J.

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install...initially had this paired with a netgear router and recently changed to a linksys router...I thought the resetup may be an issue with the linksys but it was no problem at all. Provides a good extension of our wifi signal to an area of the home that would not get signal. Remember with this unit it will only extend the strength of signal it receives, so if the closer to the main router the better.
customer_reviews.author: mikesbass

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi range extender fixes tough wi-fi reception spots
customer_reviews.text: I live full-time in an RV. There are many times that my only access to the internet is through a camp-site wireless router. I use this extender to provide a seamless link between that device and all of the internet devices in my RV. It is simple to set up, can use the same SSID and password as the 'host' WiFi device. And - it has a built-in LAN switch/router for those hard-wired printers, etc. I'm pleased even though the tech is actually at least a generation old. Fast enough to stream multiple incidents of Netflix or YouTube TV at the same time, while also allowing multiple smart devices to get and stay connected to the web.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says, exactly covered my 1800sqft house
customer_reviews.text: I've had some more puny 600sqft boosters from Netgear, the $25 ones but they weren't cutting it. The house I live in is actually quite big, basement/attic and 2 other floors, but 1800sqft length. Router is easy to install and after some testing the one signal reaches just about everywhere in the house, though I didn't test the basement. But reaches all the house, attic, and even out in the garden so my mother can play music or lookup things out there. Great product and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Vraja Carr

customer_reviews.title: 10/16/2017 - Unsafe at present - vulnerable to the Krack attack
customer_reviews.text: As of 10/16/2017, this device is susceptible to the Krack attack affecting the WPA2 protocol. Even though Netgear was notified of the vulnerability 50 days ago they have not corrected the issue nor indicated when it will be fixed. A Netgear LiveExpert has stated that we should "rest assured" that they are working on a fix, however. Until the updated firmware has been released I would say that this product is a definite "no buy" and I would be suspicious of other Netgear products due to their lackluster response to this vulnerability.
customer_reviews.author: Flipper

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money and time.
customer_reviews.text: The EX7000 extender is almost impossible to set up by strictly following instructions because it doesn't respond the way the instructions say it will. Once finally set up it cripples network speed and suffers frequent freeze-ups and disconnects. After I disconnected it to send back I discovered it had actually changed my router DHCP / static IP settings, generated 9 bogus mystery devices with IP of 0.0.0.0, and opened my firewall.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this. The update ruined it.
customer_reviews.text: Before the new firmware update, you were able to just connect to your nighthawk with no issues... you can use routerlogin.net and access this with no problem.... but now, you're not getting anything out of this... you're going to get extremely slow speeds and if you try to use the ip address access, you're only going to get your router's log in and not the nighthawk.... What did they do with this firmware update??
customer_reviews.author: Leon Camero

customer_reviews.title: within 90 days extender stoped working
customer_reviews.text: Within 90 days Extender stoped working, no internet connection. Called tech-support 3 times the same day and after 5 hours they could not get it working either. Told I could return Extender but had to pay for shipping to their warehouse to receive another Extender. I would not purchase this again, or any Netgear product ! It's in the Garbage now !
customer_reviews.author: BobZip

customer_reviews.title: Nuked my home network...but not sure I followed instructions
customer_reviews.text: I have some bits of a smart house. I got this unit to replace my old range extender for more coverage. I'm not an expert at electronics and in the end, I admit it was probably my fault, but this unit can be both a range extender and a router. Well I must have set it up wrong and it acted like a router. None of my smart devices worked since it renamed the router. Not even after I removed this from the system would my devices come back online. I had to individually reset and reconnect all of my devices back to my old router name. Returned the unit.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: EX7000 recommended
customer_reviews.text: I recommend the EX7000. I reviewed several other Range Extenders before choosing this one. i life the form factor (router-like) over the 'baby monitor' style or 'plug-in' style of others. This one has 5 ethernet connections. I can connect via wire or wireless at distance. I use the smart-feature where you connect via 5 ghz, and transmit via 2.4 ghz without any speed loss, its not a sophisticated as linksys' crosstalk (please give us this feature), but its pretty close. In real use it works great. Easy to setup. Once you get it going just forget its even there, it just works. Comparing brand, feature, price, etc., this one came out on top for me.
customer_reviews.author: Skipatroller

customer_reviews.title: To much trouble, way to slow.
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile to finally get logged into this this extender but after many tries I managed to set it up. Moved it to a area that needed better coverage and had great signal strength from the extender to the router in my office. Even then it was hit or miss if I could get anything to hook up with the extender. The download speeds through the extender were very slow. After all the hours spent messing with this thing Netgear should pay me! I returned it and ran a Cat 5e cable to the area I was having trouble with.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: what i’m going to do about this netgear wifi mesh
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand why it’s not working I’ve been trying to setup this extender 3 times but still not working until now Please help
customer_reviews.author: Ma-ell

customer_reviews.title: Keep shopping.  The device has too many issues for its longevity and price
customer_reviews.text: Had this unit for 6 months before having connection issues. The device will no longer offer internet connections nor will it recognize direct ethernet connectivity to configure. During its use - the wireless range was not very impressive. Device was located 7 feet high and only offered "fair" connection at 30 feet from our open den to a bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Art M

customer_reviews.title: utter garbage
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for maybe a month, then starting having connection issues with my router/local devices wouldn't connect to it either. In the 4th month, and now it's quit completely. Netgear customer support wants my to review Knowledgebase endlessly. After many years of of purchases, last Netgear product for me! ASUS has a new loyal customer.
customer_reviews.author: david j pilon

customer_reviews.title: INTERNET CONNECTIVITY ISSUES
customer_reviews.text: INTERNET CONNECTIVITY ISSUES ARE A PROBLEM ACCORDING TO THE COMMUNITY FORUM OF NETGEAR AND IT HAS BEEN A CONSISTENT ISSUE EVEN AFTER FOLLOWING THEIR PROPOSED SOLUTIONS. I HAVE UPLOADED A FIRMWARE UPDATE REPEATEDLY AND HAS FOLLOWED EVERY TRICK DISCUSSED IN RESOLVING THE ISSUE BUT STILL NOT ABLE TO CONNECT TO THE INTERNET. THERE IS A SOLID CONNECTIVITY BETWEEN MY PC AND THE EXTENDER AS WELL AS THE EXTENDER TO THE ROUTER BUT THE INTERNET CONNECTIVITY WHEN MY PC IS CONNECTED TO THE EXTENDER SSID JUST DOES NOT EXIST. I HAVE BEEN TRYING TO GET RESPONSE FROM THEIR SUPPORT PAGE BUT THEY WANT PAID SUPPORT ONLY
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my garage/workshop
customer_reviews.text: I have the main router (a Netgear (R7000-100PAS) Nighthawk AC1900) in my walk out basement but weak wifi in my detached workshop about 60 feet away in the backyard. I installed this extender in the workshop and now I have a very strong wifi signal in the workshop. I was surprised this worked, I thought it would need to be closer to the router inside the house. The lights on the extender tell you if the signal is strong (green light) acceptable (amber light) or poor (red light). It's green on mine even though there are 4 walls it has to travel through from the router. I'm impressed. Set up on my Mac was easy too.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuy

customer_reviews.title: Poor coverage
customer_reviews.text: I have a two story home and placed the Nighthawk upstairs to extend coverage. Consistently get an amber status light no matter where I place it. Internet speed is a fraction of what's available even for wifi. For this price you might as well go with a mesh system. This just does not work well as an extender.
customer_reviews.author: tmart

customer_reviews.title: Has stopped working after one year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device In June of last year. It has now stopped working. I previously was able to unplug it and it would restart. Now it does nothing. I believe for the money it should last longer than a year.
customer_reviews.author: ptlvr

customer_reviews.title: A Must for Outdoor Cameras
customer_reviews.text: My router is a 2014 Netgear R7000 which has suited me well for several years. I have many WiFi devices at the house and have never had a problem. I recently purchased 3 new Ring security cameras and when I went outside to do a WiFi check my download speed was only 6-7 Mbps and upload was a low 2 Mbps. Even though it worked it was very slow. I installed the Netgear EX7000 extender on the other side of the house and now I'm getting a remarkable 20 Mbps down and 3.5 up. For me it was well worth the purchase
customer_reviews.author: W. Arnhold

customer_reviews.title: I have WiFi in my barn now!!!
customer_reviews.text: I originally put this on my porch as a WiFi extender. Gave me much more distance, even gave me some signal in my field which is a ways out. Recently I ran underground cat7 cable from the house to my barn. I moved this out there, plugged it in and now I have coverage in my barn!! For the price you can't beat it. I didn't want to spend a fortune, but I didn't want to buy a cheapy that only extended the size of a room. So for those with limited service where you live. One of these will help your WiFi keeping you connected!!
customer_reviews.author: Tommyz

customer_reviews.title: If you crack patch the firmware, it will disable important features.
customer_reviews.text: These worked fine connecting out of the box using WPS, however if you set the extender up and run the latest firmware update which enables Mesh network and patches the crack hack, you will not be able to connect POS ticket printers to the extender via LAN cable, they will not receive an IP address. I have tested this with patched and unpatched extenders and the only difference between the ones that worked and didn't work with the printers was the firmware update.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR Wi-Fi Mesh Range Extender EX7000
customer_reviews.text: The device setup as extender was easy. I even upgraded the latest firmware. Almost all of my old laptops connect to this easily. However the newer cell phones / smart tv's all error out. Some say there is no network others give the error unable to obtain IP address. Very tempted to put this under the hammer and post it on youtube.
customer_reviews.author: JOHNSON C KAVANATTU

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: This product gets an A+ for me! I live in a 2300 square foot two story house and could not get a reliable internet connection upstairs. I have tried using the Netgear product that you plug into the wall but the connection was still horrible, so I would avoid that and spend the extra $60 to purchase this one. Perfect internet connection throughout the house. Tried gaming, downloading, streaming and they all worked great! This setup even has two different speeds as well, 2.4 ghz and 5ghz respectively. The 5gz speed is recommended for downloading and streaming, whereas the 2.4ghz is good for web surfing and streaming as well. So far so good, no cons on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Netgear is junk and support is a joke
customer_reviews.text: It was a piece of junk from the start. it worked good the first day then after that I had nothing but problems. had to call support several times when I was finally told to return it to seller. Support wasn't good either, had to buy a program for three hundred dollars before they would work on it to get it back up and running again. I would not buy this or any product from Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Speeds 1/10 of my main router. "F" product rating on Fakespot.
customer_reviews.text: Setup per instructions. With full strength signals, this unit only broadcasts at speeds 1/10 of my base router. Dropped conncetions galore. No combination of placement, distance to base, or antenna direction gets a faster speed. I bought this because I had a Netgear Nighthawk base router and so it makes sense to stay with the same brand. Returned after 2 days. Fakespot.com gives this product a F, even with 7000+ reviews. Hmmm.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Bestard

customer_reviews.title: Netgear Once Again AMAZES!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just completed the installation of my new MESH EXTENDER from Netgear. I have to admit, I was a little nervous about the configuration but, it was really very easy. I like the transparency of the extender. No switching networks. I had a dead spot where video would have great difficulty and now that is gone entirely! I highly recommend the Netgear AC1900 Mesh Extender paired with a Netgear AC1900 router. Great way to create a Mesh Network without having to start over. If you have a Netgear router just add the appropriate MESH EXTENDER and BAM! You have dramatically improved your network! I did not review "tech support" because I didn't use it.
customer_reviews.author: John Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Known problem with this unit on NetGeat site.
customer_reviews.text: After putting this into fast lane mode, and then trying to go back to normal operation. It will not synchronized with the Asus GT-AC5300 router. Only 32 days old. Tried manual setup after WPS failed. Tried all the recommended ways on NetGear website. Not happy with NetGear. Will try to return to NetGear. My luck just outside Amazon's 30 day window.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Karpook

customer_reviews.title: Works like middle of the road wi-fi extender
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep this simple. I make heavy use of Wifi extenders and can always tell you the performance value based on problems or issues. This extender has good range and is not hard to configure, however, it suffers from constant interruption and disconnection. I've used this product in two extremely different areas, one area is in the country where no other air traffic is apparent, and also in the city, and it drops connectivity to all devices about once every hours or so. I would not buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: LCRobertson

customer_reviews.title: This extender is a disaster with AT&T Uverse!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to extend my Wi-Fi network. Although it appeared to install properly, it did not transmit Internet through the extended network. I went through all of the online help information offered by Netgear. I spent a total of 2 1/2 hours in three different phone calls to Netgear without resolution. They eventually said I needed to speak with Uverse. Uverse also tried to correct this situation. They, too, failed. I had to return the extender for a refund after investing multiple hours trying to get it work. Thank goodness Amazon takes returns!
customer_reviews.author: Big Al 2009

customer_reviews.title: Blown Away
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade for our home from the Netgear EX2700 extender, The Nighthawk AC1900 (EX7000) extender was a great decision, After reading various reviews and doing a lot of research, I can say that I am more than pleased with my purchase. The speed is amazing (showing 144.0 Mbps currently) and it can handle my home office, family of 4 (plus lots of teenagers that hang out and ask for the wifi code first thing), xbox one play, Netflix, amazon video, Hulu, and much, much more without even a thought of any delay. Very impressed and would highly recommend to anyone that is considering the Nighthawk
customer_reviews.author: valleystationgirl

customer_reviews.title: Skip this model and consider the Netgear Orbi Mini
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this model. I tried 2 different units and finally replaced with a Netgear Orbi Mini satellite set-up which now consistently boosts my WiFi signal wonderfully throughout the home and is much easier to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Ted S.

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my old access point that had a pretty poor signal. This has a great signal in my bedroom where I keep it but you cannot leave that room. The 5 ghz signal drops out frequently enough that I don't use it at all and the 2.4 ghz only goes about 30 feet. I have changed channels and reconfigured this a few times already. I expected more from this for the price. I would send it back but I already have it configured and at least I get wifi in my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Miller

customer_reviews.title: Brought some peace
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty good at keeping peace in the house. I'm close to the signal but my parents need it to boost their stuff. Literally our house is too big but the best but guy made them believe a cheap router was good for everyone. They wouldn't even take my word because it required something twice the price. Thanks for bringing peace to the house.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Netgear nighthawk extender
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and in original packaging. The installation was quite simple though the WPS button on my Nighthawk router doesn’t work. Attached an Ethernet cable from my laptop to the extender and logged onto provided page per instructions. Followed setup wizard and brought the extender online. Tested WI-FI signal all around my wrap around porch and also walked around my yard, all is acceptable to my needs.
customer_reviews.author: K. Leach

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take care of wifi dead spots in my house. It sort of takes care of that, but only marginally. I made the mistake of upgrading firmware during installation, and couldn't be more sorry. It won't maintain a connection with my router or phone via wifi since that upgrade. Tech support is non-existant. I finally DID get it to function as a wireless access point, but it MOST CERTAINLY IS NOT worth anything as a wifi mesh extender. SAVE YOUR MONEY. THIS IS TRASH.
customer_reviews.author: TK421

customer_reviews.title: When this works it really works, but unfortunately this ...
customer_reviews.text: When this works it really works, but unfortunately this device has to be rebooted every day to continue to work. I am in the process of sending this back. I would not buy it gain.
customer_reviews.author: Lchase12

customer_reviews.title: Right now, I wish I could give it more stars
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this a couple of days so I am assuming, since it is Netgear brand, that longevity will not be an issue. That being said, I am absolutely thrilled with this. I have struggled for years with getting my wireless signal to reach into my home office. My connection has always been spotty at best. I have tried 3 previous wireless extenders and unfortunately all of those were so slow they were worse than useless. So I did not have high hopes but I was desperate for a better solution. Now, for the first time, I have fast reliable wireless in my office space as well as the rest of my house.
customer_reviews.author: JimBob

customer_reviews.title: Too many wi-fi drop offs
customer_reviews.text: Install was easy and the mesh feature eliminates having to log on to the extender every time you change rooms. I love the convenience akin to roaming on a cell phone. My frustration and the reason. For only two stars is the connection frequently experiences drop offs and the only cure is to reboot router and extenders. This has to be done far too frequently and is also causing my iPhone to switch off wi-fi and use cellular data which is going over limit and costing me $
customer_reviews.author: Shelton R. Shivers

customer_reviews.title: What a Difference!
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked my extender, plugged it up, hit the WPS buttons on router and extender once for 2.4 band, again for the 5 ghz band.....and bang! Done! I had the location picked out between my master bedroom and the family room. Distance is about 50 ft and 3 stories between the 2 locations. Put the Nighthawk halfway between the two points and fired it up. I ran tests on the 5 ghz band numous times over the next few hours. High point was 860 Mbps! I love this unit and the simplicity of connecting it. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 8 months
customer_reviews.text: I give up on NetGear wifi extenders. This one was an upgrade from a few cheaper models we tried, and it worked well until it just stopped working. Paying over $100 I expect it to last. 5ghz band is continually red, no connection at all. 2ghz shows green but nothing there is absolutely no internet access. Updated firmware , still it’s dead. Not happy. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: CV_B

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Warehouse deals - buy at your own risk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item on the Amazon Warehouse deal which was labeled as Used - Like New. It was hardly the case. a) The item had minor scuff marks. b) The Series Number was previously registered which disqualified me for installation support. c) I do not know how old this device is since it was previously registered to Netgear and d) Goes without saying, No Warranty and no way of telling how long it has been open when it was purchased by the original owner. The small price discount was not sufficient for the added risk of buying it used. I returned this to Amazon and purchased a new item.
customer_reviews.author: RH-Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Truly a great extender, but it's a nighthawk
customer_reviews.text: Went thru 3 before 1 took -- DO NOT BUY ANY RETURNED OR REHABBED ON THESE (I only buy refurbished devices, but this time it would not work at all). Best use of these is as an extender, for then you can plug things into the Ethernet ports on the back. If you use as an access point, you can't use the Ethernet ports.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Rabbt

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!’
customer_reviews.text: This unit is sooo good. I’m getting about 350 down and 25up with it. Signal is great- goes through walls and no signal decrease. Lots of customizable settings. I’ve had it for several months, prolly over a year at this point and it’s great. I’m an avid gamer, have Netflix or some streaming going on, downloads - all at once and no problems. I stream as well and RARELY drop frames. Just a great steady signal. HIGHLY REXOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: NikNak

customer_reviews.title: Started flaking after a year...
customer_reviews.text: This worked pretty well up until a few weeks ago. It started forgetting the authentication and now I've had to reset it about once a week for the passed few weeks. I just ordered a newer model so hopefully that won't have the same issue. It's frustrating that many electronics seem to crap out and force you to but a new one. Planned obselesence or planned self destruction? Not sure, but it's a shame to make the consumer buy these types of items again and again...
customer_reviews.author: HorrorGuy

customer_reviews.title: Nighthawk Wifi Mesh Extender
customer_reviews.text: Easy and simple to install. Switch the Extender on. Now, you have created your own new network. Log in, in the new network to change the extender settings. Launch a web browser from computer or mobile device, but attention, you have to change your wlan settings to the new network extender. Otherwise you aren’t in the network of your new extender. You have different address to reach the extender depending of your computer system. So I use mywifiext.net. Now follow the instructions of the extender. Please notice in advance your new password or your actually wlan password. That’s all!
customer_reviews.author: gecko

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer support - must pay for support after 90 days!
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE. Realize that when you buy this product, you are agreeing to use Net Gear's customer support. This product comes with a 90-day warranty, after that Net Gear will charge you for customer support. The product stopped working within 120 days. Customer support will not troubleshoot unless I buy an extended warranty. How convenient for the product to fail after the short warranty. They must make a nice profit from these optionS: either pay for a new router or pay for customer support.
customer_reviews.author: 210Frogman

customer_reviews.title: It works great!!
customer_reviews.text: My house is 38’ long and router was installed on the very end of the house and it wouldn’t reach into the garage which is attached to the house beyond the 38’. After finding the sweet spot, I installed the extender in a second story bedroom next to the garage. It’s hidden on the floor at the head of the bed. I’m thrilled that I can now get internet in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Ken L.

customer_reviews.title: Poor stability
customer_reviews.text: I have had this device as an access point (AP) for over six months. The problem I have with it is that every few weeks it enters a mode that, at best, will not accept any new device connections, or, at worst, will not transfer any data to the router. A power cycle fixes the problem until it happens again a few weeks later. I am truly disappointed that despite all the hype about GBits/s speed, the AP can't even do the basic thing right, that is not to crash.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 WOULD RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING OMG NO OTHER PRODUCT LIKE IT. we have the net gear router so it’s the same brand idk if that makes a difference but this extended made it doable to get WiFi downstairs finally and no other extender/router has ever worked even before my netgear! This is amazing finally a holy grail. Apartment walls are no joke at blocking signal but this blows right through it
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Drops signal once a week
customer_reviews.text: Drops signal every week. When it does work it’s great but I need to reset it once a week and makes my security cameras now unreliable. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Andy P.

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, ultra-easy to set up, but do read esp. the neg reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Not dismissing problems others have had, but I have not personally had them. Setting up consisted of hitting the WPS (?) button on both devices, router first, and in less than a minute, it was up to handle a different story of my house than the router is on. Very fast. Do read others esp. neg reviews of problems, but I read the same warnings before on some netgear products then simply perhaps got lucky, so I just have not experienced them. DISCLAIMER: I doubt it matters, but my router is also a netgear nighthawk.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Garbage do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Spotty wifi, on and off for months, now stopped working altogether. do not buy this
customer_reviews.author: Book Worm

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I don’t normally write a review but I am so disappointed in this extender. I thought for the price it would do really good and also it is connecting to a another netgear router. It worked great for about 6 months but now I have to turn it off and then back on to reset it. Very unhappy and wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: WCoyote

customer_reviews.title: Great so far...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The dual channel speed has very good extension from my Netgear Nighthawk AC1900. Great speed retention. I will monitor and update review later on if something comes up. Pros: - Easy to setup, I did it with a Chromebook - Really great speed and signal - Range is good; I am livving in a 3-story home Cons: - Price; pretty high compare to others but I tend to stick to same brand - Dimension of unit is pretty big; like a standing tower - No other issues detected so far I would recommend this if you are using the Netgear AC1900 Nighthawk Router
customer_reviews.author: Clarence H.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I tried all available ways to connect/setup - all attempts failed. Had to return. Bought the following extender - worked like a charm, from the first kick: Linksys AC3000 Max-Stream Tri-Band Wi-Fi Range Extender, Black (RE9000)
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Completely unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The extender's network will go down for seemingly no reason every other week, and a reboot won't even bring it up again. I am tired of doing a factory reset and setting it up all over again. The whole point was to make the signal stronger and more reliable than just my wifi router can. When it works, it's fine, but it never stays working for long.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing so far
customer_reviews.text: My aim was to extend my R7000 Nighthawk coverage to give a more reliable 5GHz signal in my small backyard (looking for better coverage about 40 ft. From house). Still experimenting with setup and placement, but so far results have been disappointing. I have tried setting the EX7000 as an extender and as a base station (though, once set up initially as an extender, I found no easy way to reset it as a base station without doing a hardware reset), and for now have different SSIDs for the EX7000 networks so I can tell which wifi station I'm actually connecting to. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Martin H.

customer_reviews.title: Works Flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I have 12 devices running right now on my NetGear Nighthawk X10. This Netgear AC1900 works throughout our 2500 sq. ft. house(and another 1000 ft. around house) to extend the range and clarity beautifully. It is attached to my OLED 4K TV, Playstation 4, and Yamaha Aventage in our theatre room and it does an exceptional job. Great product with no lag or bottlenecks. NetGear has been my go to system(s) for many years and i've never had issues. Easy set up with my Nighthawk X10
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Sarcasm

customer_reviews.title: make sure has current update from Netgear
customer_reviews.text: worked great off of windstream wireless anywhere in house. WPS setup worked okay but recommend using the setup web program instead as it required an update and seemed to connect faster after that. Presently have it outside in office area and is further away than it should be but works most of the time on 2.4g. Am going to try an external antenna for the office and I think it will work fine. Really was meant for the house but am moving it around. Great range.
customer_reviews.author: H. Shea

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelmed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thinking my new verizon quantum router was crap. Installation was easy, both bands connected fine and the signal appeared strong where it got placed? The speedtest on my PS3 and speedtest.verizon.net on the chromebook told a different story. Got about 2/3's the speed on the PS3 and half out of the chromebook? The PS3 can only connect up using 2.4ghz by design but the chromebook can connect to 5ghz. I thought the extender combined the two channels for an increase in speed from reading the box, but that doesn't appear the be the case?
customer_reviews.author: Todbiker

customer_reviews.title: Latest firmware made this so unreliable it went into the garbage
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this extender for about 2 years. Installed the last firmware update and it became so unreliable (ie dropped connections, inability to connect to the other router, etc.) it was simply unplugged and added to the trash. Last Netgear product I will ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: ThemAintKosherRules

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate Performane
customer_reviews.text: I work as a Network Specialist supporting finance and legal firms. I setup this unit at home, and I was initially very happy with its performance. However, after a few months of use, performance degraded, and I have discontinued using it. Internet speed degraded, some devices had inconsistent problems connecting to the network (both wired and wireless, and I had to reboot this unit almost daily to resolve problems. I switched back to the NETGEAR EX6100-100NAS AC750 WiFi Range Extender with Gigabit Ethernet that I was using before (connected it to a Linksys 8port GB network switch, and all problems resolved and internet performance improved immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: this does NOT use the same SSID as your primary router. I was led to believe it would. This does do its job of extending the main wifi signal. uptime has been near 100% even without a batt backup. Currently sitting equally between the extender and my main router (Nighthawk AX8). A speed test on my phone using 2.4ghz band has them almost equal in speed.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: This thing is the BOMB!!
customer_reviews.text: This just what I have been so fervently been looking for. The setup was very easy and configuring the extender as a access point couldn't have been easier. I tested my throughput (down and up) after placing it near my entertainment center (normally not a good idea) but was pleasantly surprised that I had no loss of signal strength. My 100Mb download service actually tested at greater than 105Mb on two different sites. Great job Netgear!!
customer_reviews.author: PBW

customer_reviews.title: Extender Works Great in RV Parks
customer_reviews.text: I am a full-time RV traveler and use WiFi at RV Parks all the time. Most RV Parks have WiFi which sometimes isn't all that great. We use the Nighthawk AC1900 WiFi Range Extender (EX7000) to extend and boost up the WiFi signal in the RV Parks we use. This Range Extender makes a major different in our WiFi use. Now we can have a strong signal almost all the time where ever we go. We can watch Netflix and do all the other things we need WiFi for. I highly recommend this Nighthawk Range Extender for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: OLee

customer_reviews.title: The performance was good. The speed was about 200-250 mbps internet over ...
customer_reviews.text: The performance was good. The speed was about 200-250 mbps internet over wireless in my living room across the house from my router. It is about the same as being in the same room as the router. The main trick is I my router is a similar netgear model. The extra power between router and access point give a good signal over the distance. All my lower power devices are in the same room as the access point. My wired internet is about 800 mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Extender.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried I paid too much and would have poor results. I was wrong. I have a 2500 sq. ft. two story house. My Apple router is on the 2nd floor in the farthest possible place from my downstairs tv. Wifi reception has been terrible. Another extender I bought didn't do anything. This router sits in the downstairs family room and now everything we own gets 100% signal strength no mater where we are. Outside in the yard as well. Incredible. Worth every penny. I totally recommend this extender for wifi woes.
customer_reviews.author: Vetten76

customer_reviews.title: Great signal expansion, worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to expand our home wifi upstairs because my room was a wifi black hole. It was easy to set up, tried the push button connect option a few times right next to the router with no success. Eventually had to do it manually but the instructions are clear and easy to follow. After it's connected to the original wifi connecting to this expansion is just like a standard wifi signal. Now I have connection speeds in the upper portion of the house like our devices are in the same room as the router. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Higginbotham

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good!
customer_reviews.text: When our old router got hit by lightening, the old model of the Netgear AC1200 also began to mess up. We use it as our extender to reach out to the other end of our house and to my father's business shop which is detached from the house. I just hooked this one up and it works way better than the old model. It feels smoother in loading pages and for streaming our Netflix in our family room. I was not sure in spending the amount for this, but I am glad that I did. The computer in my father's shop also works quite well with the internet in checking email for his business as I did test that also.
customer_reviews.author: The Holmesian TimeLady

customer_reviews.title: COVERAGE RANGE IN A HOUSE IS VERY LOW
customer_reviews.text: I have to rate it 2 Stars Because it works perfectly as advertised, BUT the range of extension is very very low. Its advertised that gives range up to 10.000 sq Feet, and if i go to the bathroom, 2 walls in the middle, but 20 feet distance... NO SIGNAL... Maybe is 10000 sq feet range in an open field, i dont know, but in a normal house does not go through walls which is essencial.
customer_reviews.author: Teyp22

customer_reviews.title: We were glad we did as the Nighthawk AC 1900 does a ...
customer_reviews.text: Boy does this range extender get the job done. Our home network was getting loaded with TV streaming, a second computer and other end points. We had the feeling that some possibilities of drop out were happening and needed an extender. We selected Netgear, which, covered all of the needs we had for expanding our range. We were glad we did as the Nighthawk AC 1900 does a fantastic job of providing the boost needed in our home network.
customer_reviews.author: Herb H

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, great WiFi
customer_reviews.text: I bought the c7000 modem/router to upgrade my network. I still had my old Netgear extender and as my motivation was to move to ac standard WiFi; a matching extender made sense. Once my modem was set up, extending my WiFi on the AC1900 was crazy easy. Just a few seconds and my new WiFi was strong in all areas of my house. My home office is located in my basement; and so extending was important to me. Most likely the C7000 modem/router would have been adequate; but I do notice the improvement.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nowlen

customer_reviews.title: The range seems pretty good though in terms of signal strength but not ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I was dropping my internet connection from upstairs. Thought it would stop that problem but it still drops but not as often. The range seems pretty good though in terms of signal strength but not sure why I still drop signal at times. Maybe it is just the spot in the house or could possibly by my computer. However I didn’t have any trouble at my old place last year with the same computer.
customer_reviews.author: babiesrfatTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed waste of money
customer_reviews.text: If you use it as a extender with a different name it works fine but as soon as you configure into a mesh network with an ac1900 it causes constant outages. Giving it two stars because I paid the extra cash for what I thought would be seamless mesh integration between two netgear products but I’ve been nothing but aggravated.
customer_reviews.author: Eman P

customer_reviews.title: Made Things Worse Rather Than Better
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for me. Not only did it not extend the range, it actually slowed down the main network. I read very positive reviews of this product, but unfortunately can't concur. Well made, great looking piece of equipment, but that's where the positives end (at least for me).
customer_reviews.author: M. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Decent router with some caveats
customer_reviews.text: I have had several Wi-Fi routers over the years including net gear devices. For some reason this one seems to have issues dropping the signal. As with any Wi-Fi device reliability can be an issue. However, I haven’t had this much of an issue with any of the other routers that I have used for the same application and in the same room.
customer_reviews.author: Student77

customer_reviews.title: i returned mine
customer_reviews.text: i bought this as I had a netgear nightnawk r7000 router and needed to extend the signal. I was optimistic about their 'one wifi name' so that we wouldn't have to switch networks manually. But the unit performed really poorly, in that I frequently disconnect and reconnect to the network. This happened on 3 different devices multiple times throughout the day. So after just 3 days I returned it. And yes, both firmwares (router and this extended) was updated as soon as I unboxed the product. I am now considering the google wifi system (after much research) even though it means abandoning my r7000.
customer_reviews.author: heyasher

customer_reviews.title: Just what the WiFi doctor ordered!
customer_reviews.text: I've got an Apple Time Capsule, and due to recent remodeling, I haven't been able to put it in an optimal spot for wifi coverage in our family room. The Nighthawk AC1900 took just minutes to install and configure. I put it in the middle of our house, out of sight on top of a large bookcase, and it has given us full signal strength everywhere, including in the front yard, where we had little or no signal previously.
customer_reviews.author: M. Yates

customer_reviews.title: Screamin'!
customer_reviews.text: I live in an apartment over a garage. The router is next door in the main house waaaay on the other side of the lower level. This extender is in the downstairs window closest to the apartment. Granted, the garage is pretty close (30 ft) from the house, but still. Setup was easy since the router had a WPS button, but I still had to set up the password on my computer, of course. I only use a Roku for television and it was very happy. So far so good, I'm sure it'll deteriorate eventually but for now it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Drumlin

customer_reviews.title: Great Extender Easy Setup Excellent Range
customer_reviews.text: I've setup a few of these. They setup easily and can be configured to use the same name as the network they are extending so you don't have 2 names to switch between. I've actually connected 2 of these to the same router with no issues and remarkable range over a 1 acre property. This model actually works better for me than the internal antenna model which is more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Phil B

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money with any other brand
customer_reviews.text: The Netgear AC1900 Nighthawk Range Extender is one of the most user-friendly products I have purchased in a very long time. From opening the box to using it for the first time took approximately 15 minutes. I have purchased Netgear products for years and have found them to be the easiest to use and backed by A+++ customer service. Before purchasing this product, I called Netgear's customer service and within a minute reached a very friendly rep who assured me this product was backward compatible with my type N Netgear router. The customer service alone is worth 5 stars. Don't waste your time or money with any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: KVMMR

customer_reviews.title: Working pretty good so far.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to extend the range of my router which is on my first floor on the opposite side of the house. I was having streaming issues in my bedroom so I put this in the corner and it improved my signal strength on that whole side of the house. Setup was pretty easy. It took about 20 min from in boxing to finish. The less expensive model probably would have done the job but this one is working pretty good so far, so no real complaints.
customer_reviews.author: IHicks

customer_reviews.title: Fixed our dead spots
customer_reviews.text: This extender corrected our WIFI dead spots in our home. Our router is on the 2nd floor of our home and we had some WIFI dead spots on our 1st floor. We installed the extender on the 1st floor and the dead spots were no longer there. Setup was a snap using the WPS function on our router. Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Thomson

product_meta.title: NETGEAR WiFi Mesh Range Extender EX7000 - Coverage up to 2100 sq.ft. and 35 devices with AC1900 Dual Band Wireless Signal Booster & Repeater (up to 1900Mbps speed), plus Mesh Smart Roaming
product_meta.description: Size:AC1900The NETGEAR Nighthawk AC1900 WiFi Range Extender boosts your existing network range, delivering extreme dual band WiFi up to 1900Mbps. The 700mW high powered amplifiers provide extreme range, while the dual core processor enables maximum WiFi performance. It works with any standard WiFi router & is ideal for HD video streaming & gaming. Get the whole home connectivity you need for iPads, smartphones, laptops & more.Range up to 10,000 square feet Dual band. Data throughput, signal range, and wireless coverage per square may vary due to differences in operating environments of wireless networks, including without limitation building materials and wireless interference. Operating temperature: 32° to 140°F (0° to 40°C). WiFi Band: Dual Band 2.4 & 5GHz
feature_bullets: EXTENDED WIRELESS COVERAGE: Adds WiFi range coverage up to 1800 sq ft, and connects up to 30 devices such as laptops, smartphones, speakers, IP cameras, tablets, IoT devices, and more
SEAMLESS SMART ROAMING: Uses your existing network SSID name so you never get disconnected as you move around your home or office
AC1900 WIFI SPEED: Provides up to 1900Mbps performance using dual band and patented FastLane(TM) technology for demanding HD streaming and online gaming
UNIVERSAL COMPATIBILITY: Works with any wireless router, gateway, or cable modem with WiFi
WIRED ETHERNET PORTS: Simply plug in game consoles, streaming players, or other wired devices into the ports for maximum speed
SAFE & SECURE: Supports WEP and WPA/WPA2 wireless security protocols

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars10,397 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
